title: poor diagnostics for `unexpected token` in recursive macro from foreign crate

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: A-macros
labels.description: Area: All kinds of macros (custom derive, macro_rules!, proc macros, ..)

body:
# Recursive

Take this recursive macro, which is supposed to check some custom syntax

``` rust
#[macro_export]
macro_rules! quick_error {
    (ERROR_CHECK $imode:tt description($expr:expr) $( $tail:tt )*)
    => { quick_error!(ERROR_CHECK $imode $($tail)*); };
    (ERROR_CHECK $imode:tt )
    => {};
}

quick_error!(ERROR_CHECK TUPLE description("1") description("2",));
```

We sneaked in some invalid `,` and expect the macro to report it.

If the macro is defined in the **same crate** as it is used, the error message is correct and helpful:

```
src/lib.rs:9:64: 9:65 error: no rules expected the token `,`
src/lib.rs:9 quick_error!(ERROR_CHECK TUPLE description("1") description("2",));
                                                                            ^
```

However, if we define this very same macro in a different crate - let's call it quick_error - import and use it like this...

``` rust
#[macro_use] extern crate quick_error;

quick_error!(ERROR_CHECK TUPLE description("1") description("2",));
```

Then we only get very poor information (**foreign crate**):

```
<quick_error macros>:333:22: 333:33 error: no rules expected the token `ERROR_CHECK`
<quick_error macros>:333 => { quick_error ! ( ERROR_CHECK $ imode $ ( $ tail ) * ) ; } ; (
                                              ^~~~~~~~~~~
```
# Non-Recursive

Note however, that macro recursion plays an important role here. If we only invoke `quick_error!(ERROR_CHECK TUPLE description("2",));` the error will occur before any macro recursion. In this case we get clear error messages in both cases

**same crate**

```
src/lib.rs:9:47: 9:48 error: no rules expected the token `,`
src/lib.rs:9 quick_error!(ERROR_CHECK TUPLE description("2",));
                                                           ^
```

**foreign crate**

```
src/lib.rs:3:47: 3:48 error: no rules expected the token `,`
src/lib.rs:3 quick_error!(ERROR_CHECK TUPLE description("2",));
                                                           ^
```

Good diagnostics is important for complex recursive macros - like that one from the quick_error crate.

> EDIT 2015-12-30: Correction "Procedural" -> "Recursive"
